repnme.cdata!:
Argentina - Trade Policy and Export
            Diversification Loan Project

abstracts.cdata!:
The Trade Policy & Export
            Diversification Project supports the first phase of the
            Government's trade policy reform program.  The
            objective of the program is to support the Government's
            adoption of an outward-looking strategy focused on improving
            export competitiveness and increasing the efficiency of
            Argentine industry. This will redress the strong anti-export
            bias in the present system of tariff and non-tariff
            protection.  It will also be linked to the maintenance of an
            adequate exchange rate.  In conjunction with the Loan, the
            Government will: (a) expand the temporary admission regime
            and introduce automaticity and uniformity in its operation,
            moving towards "free trade" status for exporters;
            (b) simplify the whole system of approvals and controls of
            trade administration; and (c) eliminate the remaining export
            taxes on manufactures and reimburse indirect taxes on
            exports; (d) rationalize the protection system and (e)
            formulate an Action Program of trade reform for the second
            phase of the trade policy reform program.  The program will
            produce an improvement in growth, efficiency and export capacity.
